page.title: 03Attitudes Chaldon Hills
page.content: The Weld Estate (see Biography The Weld Family) encourage conservation in the block by their own action.They commissioned a Hedgerow Survey of the hedges which date from 1768, when they were planted as boundaries to the Post-Enclosure farms. After the desecration of hedges in the nineteen seventies the aim is now to conserve them as our heritage.The main species discovered were Hawthorn, Ash, Gorse, Blackthorn, Elder, Bramble, Dogwood and Hazel. The tenant farmers spray fields,but avoid the hedges and verges allowing all species of wildlife to flourish (see Ecology).Members of the crow family are destroyed,but badgers are not, nor are hares.Rabbits are only culled when their numbers become a nuisance.
